newsitem.title: GERMANY: German union still mulling Lufthansa strike ballot.
newsitem.headline: German union still mulling Lufthansa strike ballot.

text.p: The German union leading worker protests against German airline Deutsche Lufthansa AG said on Wednesday it was still considering whether to ballot for all-out strikes but that no quick decision was likely.
"The wage committee meeting today is discussing the strike ballot, but nothing new is likely to emerge," a spokesman for the DAG white-collar worker union said by telephone.
He said the first opportunity for a decision on whether to ballot for strikes would come at a DAG board meeting to be held in Hamburg next Monday,

DAG, which shares representation of the airline's some 50,000 staff with the OeTV public sector and transport trade union, has already led two limited walk-outs by ground- and aircrews in a dispute over pay with the airline.
For an all-out strike, however, it needs to ballot its members and gain a 70 percent majority.
DAG says Lufthansa has refused to offer its members a 1997 wage increase in line with others in the industry. The union is seeking a rise of four percent next year.
